survey.regular-survey-description: A survey to collect Asset Characteristics, Reporting Data, Certifications, Assessments & Measures and Installations.
survey.regular-survey-note: The recipient will enter data directly in the online Survey Portal.
survey.meters-survey-description: A survey to collect/edit meter details and consumption across energy, water and waste.
i_portal.date: The ":field" field must be a valid date
i_portal.before: The ":field" field must be before ":other_field" field
general.input-form.gross_floor_area_soc_: Gross floor area - Social housing criteria
survey.meters-survey-note: The recipient will be sent a downloadable spreadsheet which they will use to edit and review data and then upload back into Scaler.
i_portal.meter_area_greater_than_area_in: :meter_area_column cannot be greater than :reporting_data_area_column of asset.
i_portal.missing_meter_row: At least one active meter is required to display data for reports and analytics.
i_portal.missing_meter_row_of_specific_t: For GRESB reporting, it is required to have at least one active :type meter.
For GRESB reporting, it is required to have at least one active :type meter in previous reporting year.
portfolio.settings.emission.national-fac: Yearly Australian national emission factors are published every 1st day of July.
portfolio.settings.emission.market-based: Market-based emission factors are specific to energy suppliers and linked to a type of energy and its production source.  The values entered should be based on contractual instruments with the energy supplier (e.g. energy attribute certificates, direct contracts or supplier-specific emissions rates). Note the instrument in the reference column below and attach documentation at the specific meter. In compliance with the GHG Protocol, where such market-based factors are not provided/available, Scaler will use the relevant location-based factors for market-based emissions accounting.

Create arbitrary regions (continents, countries, cities) where energy suppliers can have different emission factors for the same energy type. You will be able to select one of these energy supplier regions on an asset level to calculate the asset's emissions accordingly.
i_portal.located_on_potentially_contamin: Located on a potentially contaminated brownfield site
portfolio.settings.emission.national-fac: National databases: For US and Australia, if no ‘Energy network’ is selected under Asset details then calculations default to the national average.
i_portal.subject_to_investigation_for_po: Subject to investigation for potential contaminants
general.input-form.description.active: Turn this toggle on to enable the collection of current consumption data. Only when an asset is active can it be included in reporting outputs, in conjunction with the the toggle above. Only active assets are counted toward your invoice.
general.input-form.description.group_nam: Name of a (custom) group to which the asset belongs, e.g. G4 cities in the Netherlands. This field is a custom filter in the Analytics portal, so please ensure that spelling is correct.
general.input-form.description.entity_na: The legal entity to which this asset belongs.
general.input-form.description.number_of: The number of floors expressed according to the American English methodology, whereby the ground floor is counted as 1. A building which only has 1 storey, should be counted as 1. This field is used as input for determining the property sub type (low-, mid-, or high-rise).
general.input-form.description.gross_flo: The total floor area of the building including exterior walls, but excluding outdoor/exterior areas. This value must be larger than 0.
general.input-form.description.gross_int: The total gross internal area of the building, according to the definition used by CRREM: the enclosed area of a building within the external walls taking each floor into account but excluding the thickness of the external walls.
general.input-form.description.status: The 'Project started' date reflects the moment when the 'Status' of the asset was altered. When inputting a new value in the 'Status' field, Scaler will automatically designate the day before the 'Project started' date as the 'Project completed' date for the prior status.
general.input-page.embodied_carbon_end_o: Embodied Carbon - End Of Life Stage
general.input-form.description.window_gl: This field is used to differentiate between assets as double glazing is more efficient in terms of energy loss and storage than single glazing. If an asset has both single and double-paned windows, you may choose “combination”.
general.input-form.description.monumenta: Turn this toggle on to indicate that the asset has monumental status. This field is used to validate other data points as monuments may have different requirements to non monuments. This field is particularly relevant for reporting purposed, like SFDR and EU Taxonomy, as e.g. an EPC is not required for Dutch Monumental buildings.
general.input-form.avg_watt_usage_of_par: Average watt usage of parking spot with electric charging facility
general.input-form.equipped_with_facilit: Equipped with facilities for waste sorting and covered by contract
general.input-form.certification_date_su: Covers a performance period prior to or equal to reporting year.
general.input-form.total_floor_area_comm: Total floor area of community spaces for the wider community
general.input-form.number_of_individuals: Number of individuals serviced by initiative
general.input-form.carbon_offset_purchas: Carbon offset - purchased by landlord off-site electricity
Carbon offset - purchased by tenant fuels
Carbon offset - purchased by landlord district heating and cooling
general.input-form.certification_primary: Primary energy demand meets NZEB criteria
general.input-form.certification_top_per: Top percentage of the national stock in terms of PED
general.input-form.num_of_educational_an: Number of educational and social programmes introduced assisting residents in the local community
general.input-form.num_of_residents_surv: Number of residents surveyed annually who feel less lonely due to programmes
general.input-form.changing_precipitatio: Changing precipitation patterns and types (rain, hail, snow/ice)
general.input-form.climate_hazards_consi: For climate hazards considered material, relevant adaption solutions have been implemented at buiding level over a period of time of up to 5 years
general.input-form.expected_lifespan_of_: Expected lifespan of the building in years
general.input-form.vulnerability_assessm: The vulnerability assessment is performed at least by using climate projections at the smallest appropriate scale
The vulnerability assessment is performed using the highest available resolution, state-of-the-art climate projections across the existing future scenario consistent with the lifetime
general.input-form.climate_projections_a: The climate projections and assessment are performed in line with best practice and guidance, taking into account state-of-the-art science and risk analysis in line with IPCC and scientific publications
i_portal.date_should_be_after_the_date_i: The "":field" field" field should be after ":date_column" field in latest version
i_portal.meter_for_non_exising_area: Floor area for the selected Area type for this meter doesn't exist
i_portal.both_tenant_and_landlord_contro: Please note that the Whole Building Energy, Water and Waste meters aren't all marked as controlled by the same type (Tenant or Landlord). Please verify the accuracy of the Area type field under Meter details of all your active meters, and ensure this is aligned.
i_portal.both_whole_and_non_whole_buildi: It's not possible to have Whole building AND non-Whole building meters for the same resource type
general.input-form.current_loan_expiry: Current loan expiry (including executed extension options, if any)
general.input-form.extension_options_to_: Extension options to current loan expiry (if any)
general.input-form.describe_criteria_for: Describe criteria for executing extention options
general.input-form.ltv_covenant_conseque: LTV Covenant - Consequence of covenant breach
general.input-form.ltv_covenant_cure_per: LTV Covenant - Cure period for breach
general.input-form.ltv_covenant_date_of_: LTV Covenant - Date of next test
general.input-form.current_gross_equity_: Current gross equity multiple as of end reporting period
general.input-form.projected_gross_irr_a: Projected gross IRR as of end reporting period
general.input-form.projected_gross_equit: Projected gross equity multiple as of end reporting period
i_portal.reporting_data_area_not_fully_c: Meters must be created corresponding to the related area types in “Reporting data” and their total size must equal the GFA of the asset. This can be done either through whole-building meters or a combination of both tenant and common area meters.  If there is an area for which no data has been collected, create a meter corresponding to that size and area type and leave the consumption value blank to represent unknown data.
i_portal.consumption_can_not_overlap_wit: Consumption period can not overlap with more than one meter version
i_portal.no_meter_version_in_consumption: No matching meter version found for the selected consumption period
i_portal.consumption_period_overlaps_wit: Consumption period overlaps with multiple meter versions
i_portal.consumption_period_not_fully_co: The corresponding meter version does not fully cover the selected consumption period
i_portal.relative_difference_exceeds_thr: The relative difference between the previous consumption value and the current value exceeds the thresholds set by Scaler. Energy consumptions threshold range is set to [:min_threshold_energy, :max_threshold_energy]. Water and Waste consumptions have a threshold of [:min_threshold_other, :max_threshold_other]

The relative difference between the current consumption value and the next value exceeds the thresholds set by Scaler. Energy consumptions threshold range is set to [:min_threshold_energy, :max_threshold_energy]. Water and Waste consumptions have a threshold of [:min_threshold_other, :max_threshold_other]
i_portal.same_as_field: The ":field" field must have same value as ":other_field" field
i_portal.must_be_null: The ":field" field must not have value, and be null
i_portal.unique: The ":field" field already exists while it must be unique
i_portal.string: The ":field" field must be a valid string
i_portal.must_be_one_of: The ":field" field must have one of values :values
i_portal.numeric: The ":field" field must be a number
i_portal.numeric_range: The ":field" field must be a number between :min and :max
i_portal.min: The ":field" field must be at least :min.
i_portal.max: The ":field" field may not be greater than :max
i_portal.exists_in_database: The ":field" field doesn't exist in database
i_portal.belongs_to: The ":field" field must belong to selected ":parent_field" field
general.input-form.dscr_covenant_consequ: DSCR Covenant - Consequence of covenant breach
general.input-form.dscr_covenant_cure_pe: DSCR Covenant - Cure period for breach
general.input-form.dscr_covenant_date_of: DSCR Covenant - Date of next test
general.input-form.icr_covenant_conseque: ICR Covenant - Consequence of covenant breach
general.input-form.dhw_system_type_of_sy: Type of system (centralised/ decentralised - under sink boiler etc.)
general.input-form.number_of_separate_wa: Number of separate waste streams collected
general.input-form.number_of_individuals: Number of individuals serviced by initiative
general.input-form.percentage_of_noi_inv: Percentage of NOI invested in sustainable activities
general.input-form.description.date_of_a: The date of the application for a construction permit is relevant for the application of the EU Taxonomy criteria. It determines when a property was 'built' and therefore determines what specific criteria should be met.
general.input-form.climate_risk_and_vuln: Climate risk and vulnerability assessment is performed to verify which of the climate hazards listed in appendix A are material
general.input-form.current_gross_irr_end: Current gross IRR end of reporting period (realised or with book value if unrealised)
i_portal.consumption_is_0_warning: Note that a 0 consumption is entered, meaning the consumption for this period was actually 0. If the consumption is unknown, no consumption entry should be added.
general.are-you-sure-you-want-to-discard: Are you sure you want to discard your changes?
general.cost-coverage-explanation: Number of available consumptions for which the cost has not been covered.
general.input-form.certification_date_su: Date of all evidence for final review has been submitted
general.input-form.adaptation_solutions_: The adaptation solutions implemented do not adversely affect the adaptation efforts or the level of resilience to physical climate risks of other people, of nature, of cultural heritage, of assets and of other economic activities
general.input-form.description.external_: A unique ID that is used internally to identify the asset, usually found within your own administrative systems.
general.input-form.description.covered_a:
The floor area that corresponds to this meter.
Please note:
a) The floor area entered cannot exceed the corresponding area entered under Reporting data for that reporting year;
b) If you do not enter a value manually for the covered area, the platform will use the corresponding area entered under Reporting data to populate this field;
c) If multiple meters are added covering the same 'Area type' and their total 'Covered area' exceeds the corresponding floor area entered in Reporting data, the consumption values will be added for all meters, but the maximum floor area used will be the floor are entered in 'Reporting data'.
d) Between Reporting data and 'Meter details', the area types map as follows:
- Gross floor area = Whole building
- Gross floor area = Shared services
- Common areas = Common area
- Tenant areas = Tenant space
asset.details.amount-of-parking-spots-wi: Amount of parking spots with electric charging facilities
asset.details.primary-energy-usage-from-: Primary energy usage from the EPC label
general.input-form.description.default_u:
The unit system selected for this asset. Please be sure that all data input for this asset is according to this unit system, which may vary from the default unit of the portfolio and what is seen by an individual user.

                By default, newly added assets are assigned the portfolio unit system, found under Portfolio Settings in the Data Collection Portal. Changing the unit system of an individual asset does not impact other assets or the unit system of the portfolio.
i_portal.before_or_equal: The ":field" field must be before or equal ":other_field" field
i_portal.after: The ":field" field must be after ":other_field" field
i_portal.after_or_equal: The ":field" field must be after or equal ":other_field" field
i_portal.boolean: The ":field" field must be true or false
i_portal.gte: The ":field" field must be greater than or equal to ":other_field" field
i_portal.lte: The ":field" field must be less than or equal to ":other_field" field
i_portal.equals_to_sum: The sum of ":operand1" field and ":operand2" field must be equal to ":sum" field
i_portal.status_must_cover_the_entire_ye: Status does not cover the entire year
i_portal.must_be_filled_for_current_year: Must fill in field for current year for GRESB. If not populated in this reporting period, outdated value for this field will be included in output.
i_portal.recommended_to_be_filled_for_cu: Recommended to fill in field for current year for GRESB. If not populated in this reporting period, outdated value for this field will be included in output.
i_portal.must_be_filled_for_previous_yea: Must fill in field for previous year for GRESB. If not populated in this reporting period, outdated value for this field will be included in output.
i_portal.recommended_to_be_filled_for_pr: Recommended to fill in field for previous year for GRESB. If not populated in this reporting period, outdated value for this field will be included in output.
i_portal.period_overlaps_with_existing_p: The period overlaps with the existing period
i_portal.missing_certification_row: There should be at least one certification record
i_portal.measures_taken_to_reduce_noise_: Measures taken to reduce noise, dust, and pollutant emissions
i_portal.both_tenant_and_landlord_contro: Across and/or within Resources (energy, water, waste), there is misalignment in operational control (landlord vs. tenant) for 'Whole-building' meters. Please check that this is accurate and update the "Area type" variable where necessary. Please note: Where there are any 'Whole building - Landlord controlled' energy meters, GRESB requires that the entire asset be reported as 'Whole building - Tenant controlled'= FALSE. This impacts how energy consumption and GHG emissions can be reported and the interpretation of the landlord's ability to introduce and implement operating policies, which may impact scoring.

GRESB requires that Whole Building meters across and within Resources (energy, water, waste) all have the same operational control (landlord vs. tenant). Please align  the operational control across meters in the "Area type" variable.
i_portal.regex: The ":field" field must contain digits only
portfolio.settings.emission.market-based:
Create custom regions where energy suppliers within your portfolio have different emission factors for the same energy Subcategory + Source combination.

You will then need to link an Asset to this custom region by choosing the appropriate option from the Energy supplier region drop-down in Asset Details.

general.filters.only-assets-included-in-: Only assets included in reporting outputs
general.input-form.description.region: Custom region for which you have market-based emissions factors from your energy supplier. The geographical scope of the region is dependent on your energy supplier. In the Collection Portal, create regions and populate their emissions factors under Portfolio Settings. Then assign the relevant region per asset under the Location section under asset data.

portfolio.overview.scaler-esg-score-desc: Derived from performance across 7 ESG aspects and weighted based on industry standards, the score includes data coverage, like-for-like change and risk, but also considers the impact of performance intensities.
general.filters.owned-for-entire-period: Owned for 12 months during reporting year
general.surveys.review-survey-info:
New data collected via this survey is black. Existing data currently in Scaler is gray.

        Review the below survey for correctness. If you are satisfied, approve the survey by clicking the ‘Approve’ button in the top right corner. 'Approved' surveys auto-populate data in the Scaler Platform.

        To request changes to the newly collected data, click ‘Request changes’ in the top right corner. Select the relevant fields and add comments to explain the request.

        You can edit existing data for this asset in the Scaler Platform by clicking ‘Edit existing data’.
portfolio.overview.scaler-esg-score-desc: Out of a total 100 points, it provides you with a useful indication of average overall risk at the portfolio level and an acute reflection of actual building performance, risks, and opportunities at the asset level.
portfolio.overview.scaler-esg-score-info: How do we calculate the score?
portfolio.roadmap.net-zero-carbon-score-: Based on the CRREM Methodology, a score of 0 means that an asset or portfolio is already stranded in the current reporting year. A score of 100 means that an asset or portfolio is completely NZC according to the CRREM pathways.
general.filters.title: Filters:
general.charts.tooltip.asset-not-owned-f: Asset is not owned for the entire reporting year
i_portal.required_for_estimations: Estimate using solar panel data option has been set to TRUE on meter level. In order to estimate estimate consumption data for this type of meter, this field has to be populated for the corresponding reporting year.
general.charts.tooltip.asset-not-owned-f: Asset not owned for full year but since:
Asset not owned for full year but until:
Asset not owned for full year but ~
portfolio.esg-data.emissions.default-fac: These metrics were calculated using our default location-based emissions factors. Toggle to the Data Collection Portal and navigate to Portfolio > Settings > Emission Factors to overwrite the default factors, or input your own market-based emission factors.
portfolio.esg-data.emissions.custom-fact: Toggle to the Data Collection Portal and navigate to Portfolio > Settings to verify you are satisfied with the emissions factors used. If desired, you can overwrite these default factors or edit market-based emission factors.
portfolio.esg-data.engagement.satisfacti: Tenant satisfaction survey conducted in the last three years
portfolio.roadmap.emissions.market-based: These metrics were calculated using our custom location-based emissions factors. Toggle to the Data Collection Portal and navigate to Portfolio > Settings to verify you are satisfied with the emissions factors used.
portfolio.roadmap.assets.stranded-energy: Year the asset becomes stranded based on the projected EUI and CRREM v2 1.5 degree pathway
portfolio.roadmap.assets.stranded-carbon: Year the asset becomes stranded based on GHG emissions intensity and CRREM v2 1.5 degree pathway
portfolio.roadmap.assets.measures-invali: Cost must be equal to sum of Cost tenant and Cost landlord
Cost is not equal to sum of other Cost details fields
general.tenant-events-focused-on-increas: Tenant events focused on increasing ESG awareness
portfolio.roadmap.assets.measures-invali: Not equal to sum of Landlord Unallocated budget and Allocated budget
The Measure group field is required.
Status is not allowed for this measure
portfolio.roadmap.assets.eui-red.desc: The estimated reduction in energy use intensity. This value will be used in EUI projection calculations for this asset and will impact its energy pathway and GHG/CO2 pathway (as a factor of the energy source it is reducing). The value must be entered in kWh/sqm or kWh/sqft.
portfolio.roadmap.assets.eui-red-on-site: The estimated reduction in off-site energy use intensity due to on-site renewable electricity. This value will be used only in CUI projection calculations for this asset and will therefore only impact the GHG pathway (as a factor of the energy source it is reducing). The value must be entered in kWh/sqm or kWh/sqft.
The energy source that will be reduced as a result of implementing this measure.
portfolio.roadmap.assets.asset-measure-t: The estimated reduction in energy use intensity. This value will not be used in EUI projection calculations for this asset, and will impact only GHG/CO2 pathway (as a factor of the energy source it is reducing). The value must be entered in kWh/sqm or kWh/sqft.
portfolio.gresb-data.modelere.warning: The GRESB Modeler is meant to be indicative, not predict your GRESB Score. It is limited where not all data points have been inputted and does not take benchmarking into consideration. The modeler is being updated to include 2024 scoring changes.
portfolio.gresb-data.gresb-asset-score.d: Provides a prediction of the points you can achieve for performance indicators directed at asset-level data (56.5/100 points in the real estate benchmark). The 56.5 points are normalized into a score out of 100.
The score is based on the current GRESB Real Estate Scoring Document. It does not account for the impact of annual benchmarking on scores.
portfolio.gresb-data.engagement.satisfac: Tenant Satisfaction Survey conducted in the last three years
asset.gresb-data.gresb-asset-score.desc-: The GRESB Asset Score applies the GRESB Scoring Methodology at the asset level, for asset-level indicators in the Performance Component.
It indicates what percentage of the total points available for asset-level indicators this asset can achieve.
asset.gresb-data.asset-score.desc-1: The Asset Score applies the Scoring Methodology at the asset level, for asset-level indicators in the Performance Component.
asset.gresb-data.asset-score.desc-2: It indicates what percentage of the total points available for asset-level indicators this asset can achieve.
portfolio.target.add-comments: Add comments about the target here
portfolio.target.target-exists-error: Target for this year already exists!
portfolio.target.name.already-exists: Target with the same name, aspect and metric already exists!
portfolio.target.include-embodied-carbon: Does the target include embodied carbon?
portfolio.target.net-zero-target-setting: Is the target aligned with a Net-Zero target setting framework?
portfolio.target.unit-info: The unit system for this portfolio is set to :unitSystem. Please enter the target goal in this unit system. You can change this in Collection mode under Portfolio -> Settings.
portfolio.target.name.description: A unique name used internally or externally for this target.
portfolio.target.metric.description: The performance aspect this target relates to.
portfolio.target.metric.error.existing-g: An existing data coverage target is being reported to GRESB (':targetName').
portfolio.target.type.description: The metric this target relates to.
portfolio.target.goal.description: The value of the metric that you aim to achieve.
portfolio.target.year.description: The year by which you aim to achieve this target.
portfolio.target.note.placeholder: Explain the methodology used to establish the targets
portfolio.target.show-in-analytics.expla: Only custom targets with aspect Energy, Water, Waste, and GhG emissions- Scope 1,2 (location-based),3 (operational emissions) are currently available in Analytics.
general.tenant-engagement-program-that-i: Tenant engagement program in place that includes ESG-specific issues
general.tables.fit-out-refurbishment-pro: Fit-out and refurbishment assistance for meeting the minimum fit-out standards
user.profile.profile-information.desc: Update your account's profile information and email address.
user.profile.update-password.desc: Ensure your account is using a long, random password to stay secure.
user.profile.logout.title: Browser Sessions
user.profile.update-password.desc-2: Please add more complex password! It should be a combination of uppercase and lowercase characters, numbers, and special characters.
user.profile.delete-account.desc-2: Once your account is deleted, all of its resources and data will be permanently deleted. Before deleting your account, please download any data or information that you wish to retain.
user.profile.delete-account-confirm: Are you sure you want to delete your account? Once your account is deleted, all of its resources and data will be permanently deleted. Please enter your password to confirm you would like to permanently delete your account.
user.profile.2fa.title: Two Factor Authentication
user.profile.2fa.desc: Add additional security to your account using two factor authentication.
user.profile.2fa.enabled: You have enabled two factor authentication.
user.profile.2fa.not-enabled: You have not enabled two factor authentication.
i_portal.common_area_or_tenant_area_mete: In order to correctly report to GRESB, either (only) Whole Building meters or a combination of Common Area AND tenant area meters must be created. If only tenant area meters exist, at least one Common Area meter must be created. If only Common Area meters exist, at least one Common Area meter must be created.
user.profile.2fa.desc-2: When two factor authentication is enabled, you will be prompted for a secure, random token during authentication. You may retrieve this token from your phone's Google Authenticator application.
user.profile.2fa.desc-3: Two factor authentication is now enabled. Scan the following QR code using your phone's authenticator application.
user.profile.2fa.desc-4: Store these recovery codes in a secure password manager. They can be used to recover access to your account if your two factor authentication device is lost.
user.profile.logout.desc-1: Manage and log out of your active sessions on other browsers and devices.
user.profile.logout.desc-2: If necessary, you may log out of all of your other browser sessions across all of your devices. Some of your recent sessions are listed below; however, this list may not be exhaustive. If you feel your account has been compromised, you should also update your password.
user.profile.logout.confirm: Please enter your password to confirm you would like to log out of your other browser sessions across all of your devices.
company.users.delete-user-confirm: Are you sure you want to delete user :name? Once the user is deleted, all of its resources and data will be permanently deleted.

confirm-password.title: This is a secure area of the application. Please confirm your password before continuing.
verify-email.title: Thanks for signing up! Before getting started, could you verify your email address by clicking on the link we just emailed to you? If you didn't receive the email, we will gladly send you another.
verify-email.desc: A new verification link has been sent to the email address you provided during registration.
reset-password.desc: To complete your registration set a password for your account below.
reset-password.desc-2: To reset your password set a new password for your account below.

asset.data-quality.info.title: How to interpret data outlier indicators
asset.data-quality.info.explanation: These indicators reflect whether the values for intensities and like-for-like metrics fall outside (or within) the expected range for the given property type.
asset.data-quality.download.info: Scaler uses the GRESB outlier thresholds and uses an algorithm to determine higher/lower and much higher/much lower indications.
asset.data-quality.download.title: Download data outlier thresholds as a spreadsheet
asset.data-quality.error.down: Value is much lower than normal

general.generate-report.step-1.desc-1-gr: 100% data completion of relevant metrics is required for each asset before you can generate this report.

100% data completion of relevant metrics is required for each asset before you can generate this report.   When generating your GRESB Asset Spreadsheet, please ensure alignment between Scaler and the GRESB Portal. For more detailed information, hover over the "ï" icon
general.generate-report.step-1.desc-2: Generate and review report in the XLSX format. If data is changed after generating, please re-generate the report.
general.generate-report.step-1.desc-2-gr:
Generate and review report in the XLSX format. If data is changed after generating, please re-generate the report.

        If interested, we can provide an audit supplement file with variables and calculations for the GRI Annual Report. Please reach out to client-services@scalerglobal.com.

Generate and review report in the XLSX format. If data is changed after generating, please re-generate the report. When generating your GRESB Asset Spreadsheet, please ensure alignment between Scaler and the GRESB Portal. For more detailed information, hover over the "i" icon.
general.generate-report.step-2.desc-1: Please allow up to two minutes for the report to generate.
general.generate-report.step-3.desc-1: Publish this report to make it available in Collection and Analytics mode. Refresh if any data is changed before publishing.
general.generate-report.step-3.desc-2: Congrats! Your :type :year report is complete and available for download to your entire team.
general.generate-report.generate-button-: 100% data completion is required to generate this report

general.generate-report.modal-desc: Audit trail includes calculation explanation, unit conversion factors, emissions factors, and an asset level data export.
